item.title: From One Table to Another and Back Again
item.description: 1 Inevitable 2 Coordinatized 3 One Data to Compare Them All 3.1 Gather and Spread 3.2 Melt and (D)Cast 3.3 Reshape 3.4 Rowrecs and Blocks 4 For Future Me and Collaborators 5 Code 6 References # Attach packages and set chunk options xfun::pkg_attach( "knitr", "DT", "data.table", "cdata", "tidyr", "tibble" ) opts_chunk$set( message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, echo = TRUE ) # create standard datatable function to be used in all tables in this post show_datatable <- function(data) { data %>% DT::datatable( rownames = FALSE, extensions = 'FixedColumns', options = list( pageLength = 20, scrollX = TRUE, scrollCollapse = TRUE, columnDefs = list( list( className = 'dt-center', targets = 0:(ncol(data) - 1) ) ) ) ) } 1 Inevitable With my current work as a junior data scientist, I have to manipulate a lot of data to get to a desired output or a possible answer to a question.
